heading: 5 year
goals: Honestly, I want to be sitting on a beach in Malaysia in five years.

I want a remote programming and/or UX design job that pays me more than 100k a year. I want to own a sweet house, a nice motorbike, and be married to (or seriously dating) an awesome lady. I want that house to be ON the beach in a Southeast Asian country.
When I fall asleep, I’m listening to the ocean and the foreign languages of fishermen chattering outside my window.
I want a second house in the Colorado Rockies with a beautiful view of the mountains. It can be a cabin or a shitty house. I don’t care, as long as I own land with a structure on it.
I also want to be happy and content.
See this is where my plans break down because I need to interact with people in real life or I get depressed.
So a remote job? Not great.
Living in Malaysia where I don’t know the language? Not great.
Being isolated in the Colorado Rockies? Not great.
What do I actually want? Honestly, I just want to be good. Like never worry about money ever again, good. I do alright at Jax, but I’ve been broke before and that shit sucks.
Anyone who says money can’t buy happiness is right but with the caveat: it makes it a lot easier to be.
I think having money gives you options and I want to explore those options.
lus, what happens if I get cancer or the parachute rips and I fall, breaking every bone in my body? I would be so screwed. Those medical bills alone would flatline me.
Wow. That was a tangent.

heading: Annyway, TL;DR :
goals: I want to be great at my job and be known for it.
I’d like to love what I do.
I want to have some stocks/investments and financial literacy.
I want a muscle car and maybe a restaurant.
Beach house in Malaysia.
Cabin in the Rockies.
Cool partner.
Good healthcare.
Retirement security.
More than 100k a year.
Have a community.
Be happy.
Have a nice view.
Good coffee.
Travel.

heading: End of course
goals: By the end of the course I would like to be able to be handed a project, look at it and say “Bet. I can do this.” and ask a few follow-up questions and start working. I want that confidence and the skills to back it up.
I want to be set up with a portfolio of work that will impress employers and some experience under my belt. I also want to understand what I’m doing, not just googling “how do I..”
A little of that is fine but I better not be looking up “how to JavaScript?”
Landing a job or high-paying jig is also paramount.
What don’t I want to happen?
I don’t want to come out of this with one skill. I’d like to be an asset and understand design and code.

heading: End of Month
goals: By the end of the month, I would like to feel confident with PHP, structuring a website, and quicker with key shortcuts. I’d also like to be caught up in the course.
I want my personal webpages to stand out, be consistent and be visually appealing.

heading: End of the Week
goals: By the end of the week, I would like to have all of the catchup work finished and be on track for next week. I want to understand all the concepts we’ve covered and feel confident in talking about them.
